New Records: Jasprit Bumrah clocked an average speed of 137kph, and took as long as the third ball of his second over to hit 140 clicks
Key Match Events: Jasprit Bumrah led from the front and bagged the Player of the Match award as #TeamIndia win the first #IREvIND T20I by 2 runs via DLS
Jasprit Bumrah's comeback moment came not with the ball in his hand, but when he leapt like a hurdler over Ravi Bishnoi’s sliding body near the boundary rope
Jasprit Bumrah began the second over with an unusual half-tracker, duly pulled for four, but ended the over with four straight dot balls
Pre-Game Insights: Jasprit Bumrah sounded relaxed in the pre-match press conference, but deep inside, his mind might have been tossing like the waves of an ocean, restless and anxious to test himself out in a competitive setting
Post-Match Reflections: Jasprit Bumrah might not have reached his most destructive zone yet, but he showed signs of promise that he is hovering in the vicinity of that space
Jasprit Bumrah was raucously cheered for every ball
Miscellaneous Highlights: The result of the game—which India won by two runs on DLS after unrelenting downpour stalled India’s progress at 47/2, chasing 140—seemed largely inconsequential

The Indian bowler Jasprit Bumrah celebrates with teammates after a wicket of Ireland during the 1st T20 cricket match between India and Ireland, at The Village stadium in Malahide, Ireland, Friday, Aug. 18, 2023
Others: Jasprit Bumrah was not as lethal as his two-wicket first-over burst suggests, but he was not as off-the-radar as his 13-run third over implied
The nervous excitement assumed the form of a leg-stump half-volley that Andy Balbirnie crunched for a four
